REGULAR MEETING
OCTOBER 16, 2023
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, October 16, 2023

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui

1. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting - October 2, 2023 5:30 PM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED

2. Minutes of the Special Tax Meeting – October 2, 2023 6:30 PM
RESULT:
ACCEPTED

PAGE 1

Oct 16, 2023

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
2,040,086.98 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund School Extraordinary Expenditures
account to fund the Amigos School roof replacement project.
CMA 2023 #252
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$8,325,000, from Free Cash to the General Fund Department of Public Works Salary and Wages
account, which will replenish funds that were used for the “friendly” eminent domain taking of a
parcel located at 41 Bellis Circle.
CMA 2023 #253
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the reappointment of
Vinita Bhaskar as a member of the Committee on the Public Planting for a term of two years.
CMA 2023 #254
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

4. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appointments and
reappointments of the following persons to the Conservation Commission. Reappointments: Purvi
Patel and Erum Sattar. Appointments: Patricia Carney, Angela Zhong, and John Leo.
CMA 2023 #255
RESULT:
APPROVED AND PLACE ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 2

Oct 16, 2023

5. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Policy Order #23-147,
regarding a report on whether change in language to the CSO is necessary to enable installation of
permanent, seasonal, and/or temporary outdoor dining and pop-ups alongside separated bicycle lanes
consistent with Cycling Safety Ordinance that address concerns about the current situation.
CMA 2023 #256
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [8-1-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Zondervan

6. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the establishment of an
Opioid Settlement Stabilization Fund.
CMA 2023 #257
RESULT:
ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

7. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$1,903,731.64 from Free Cash to the Opioid Settlement Stabilization Fund. The $1,903,731.64
appropriated to the Opioid Settlement Stabilization Fund is the only the appropriation from Free Cash
attributed to Opioid Settlement funds and will be used to fund specific future projects, per
requirements of the settlement agreement, which will require separate individual appropriations by
the City Council.
CMA 2023 #258
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

8. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item
Number 23-23 which clarifies the state law on zoning petition signature requirements to ensure clarity
and lawful deliberation in the future.
CMA 2023 #259
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 3

Oct 16, 2023

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the City Manager is requested to work with the License Commission and other relevant
departments to prepare recommendations on regulations that would ban or limit the sale of nips in
Cambridge.
POR 2023 #177
Councillor Nolan, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY SUBSTITUTION

2. That the City Manager is requested to reaffirm the city’s commitment to renovating the
schoolhouse at 105 Windsor Street as a top priority following the completion of the Central
Square lots study.
POR 2023 #178
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY SUBSTITUTION

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
3. An Ordinance has been received from City Council, relative to Affordable Housing Overlay
(AHO) amendments. (Proposed Ordinance #2023-7)
ORD 2023 # 7
RESULT:
ORDAINED [6-3-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor
Simmons, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner

FINALIZED IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 16, 2023

4. An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to 2.76.020 enacted is to protect the
human rights of all the residents of the City Protect Family Inclusion and Relationship Diversity
PASSED TO A SECOND READING OCTOBER 2 2023
ORD 2023 # 8
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 10/30/2023 5:30 PM

Oct 16, 2023

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from MIT Lit Visual Arts Center requesting permission for a (35) Thirty
Five temporary banners Ames Street, Memorial Drive to Main Street, Ames Street, Main Street to
Broadway, Broadway, Ames Street to Third Street, Third Street, Broadway to Main Street, Main
Street, Third Street to Broadway announcing MIT Visual Arts Center and Contemporary Art from
October 2023 through April 2024.
APP 2023 #52
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. An application was received from Mike Tokatlyan, requesting permission for a curb cut at the
premises numbered 22 White Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services,
Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. Response has been
received from the neighborhood association.
APP 2023 #53
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. An application was received from Central Square Theater requesting permission for a (12) twelve
temporary pole banners along Massachusetts Avenue from Essex Street to Sidney announcing
Richard O'Brien's The Rocky Horror Show from October 13, 2023 through December 10, 2023.
APP 2023 #54
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 5

Oct 16, 2023

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Congratulations to Judy Vellucci on her retirement from the City of Cambridge.
Councillor Toner, Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2023 #268
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. Congratulations to Cambridge Police Lieutenant Stephen Sennott on the occasion of his promotion.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #269
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. Congratulations to Cambridge Police Lieutenant Frederick Leung on his recent promotion.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #270
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

4. Congratulations to Cambridge Police Sergeant Mark Clavette on his recent promotion.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #271
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

5. Congratulations to Cambridge Police Sergeant Simon Valentin on his recent promotion.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #272
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

6. Thanks to Mary White for her contributions to Cambridge.
Councillor Toner, Councillor Nolan and entire membership.
RES 2023 #273
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED

7. Speedy Recovery wishes to Roslyn Shoy.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2023 #274
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 13

Oct 16, 2023

8. Congratulations to Amigos da Terca on Their Annual Dinner/Dance on October 7, 2023.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #275
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

9. Condolences To the Family of Dr. Marcella Mazzarelli
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2023 #276
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

10. Congratulations to Harvard Economics Professor Claudia D. Goldin on winning the 2023 Nobel Prize
in Economics.
Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2023 #277
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

11. Congratulations to the Benjamin Banneker Charter School on its achievements.
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #278
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

12. Resolution on the retirement of Steven A. Cohen from the City of Cambridge Planning Board.
Councillor Carlone and entire membership.
RES 2023 #279
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

13. Resolution of the retirement of Hugh Adams Russell from the City of Cambridge Planning Board.
Councillor Carlone and entire membership.
RES 2023 #280
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 14

Oct 16, 2023

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. Policy Order re Breast Cancer Awareness Month
POR 2023 #179
Councillor Simmons, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. That the City Council go on record recognizing October 2023 as National Women's Small Business
Month.
POR 2023 #180
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate staff to conduct a comprehensive
assessment of the overall state of the Moses Youth Center building.
POR 2023 #181
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

4. That the City Manager is requested to conduct a thorough assessment regarding the feasibility, costs,
and benefits of replacing the existing community notice boards on the front lawn of City Hall with
one or two digital signs.
POR 2023 #182
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

5. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Law Department, the Finance Department, and
any other relevant departments to investigate potential mechanisms to support Cannabis Business in
Cambridge.
POR 2023 #183
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to create a
dedicated page on the City of Cambridge's website listing all community-based organizations
providing services in The Port neighborhood.
POR 2023 #184
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 15

Oct 16, 2023

7. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to establish an American
Freedmen Commission.
POR 2023 #185
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AND REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE
FOR DISCUSSION

FINALIZED IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 16, 2023

8. That the City Council schedule a roundtable on Monday, November 13, 2023, from 3 p.m-5 p.m. to
receive an update from the City Manager and relevant departments on the Central Square City Lots
Study.
POR 2023 #186
Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

9. That the City Manager is requested to work with DPW to restore Linear Park by re-using the existing
award-winning design, to create, publish and implement a climate resilience-based maintenance plan
and minimize the embodied carbon of the project by re-using, wherever possible, the existing lamps
and lamp posts.
POR 2023 #187
Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED AND REFERRED TO THE
NEIGHBORHOOD AND LONG-TERM PLANING, PUBLIC FACILITIES,
ARTS & PUBLIC CELEBRATION COMMITTEE

PAGE 16

Oct 16, 2023
